summary: The @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry package.json references non-existent entry points (lib/index.js and lib/index.d.ts), causing import failures. Users must import from specific subpaths like lib/worker instead.
userImpact: Users cannot import from the @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry package root and receive TypeScript compilation errors.
rootCause: package.json main and types fields point to lib/index.js and lib/index.d.ts which don't exist in the published package
proposedFix: Update package.json to reference correct entry points (lib/worker, lib/client, lib/workflow) or provide a proper root index file
workaround: Import from specific subpaths: @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry/lib/worker instead of root package
resolutionDetails: Author committed to fixing package.json and provided guidance to import from specific subpaths
keyQuote: There's nothing to import at the root of this package, you should import from `lib/client`, `lib/worker` and `lib/workflow`
